intro: Banisteriopsis quadriglandula, commonly known as the "Amazonian snakeroot," is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves with four glandular dots. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by small, round fruits containing seeds. It is notable for its traditional use in folk medicine, particularly for its potential anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical plant biodiversity.
